item.title: The FCA wants to approve blockchain startups in England | HolyTransaction
item.description:
The FCA wants to approve blockchain startups in England | HolyTransaction

In fact, a "small but significant number of firms" that use the blockchain and works in the fintech industry could officially receive the FCA authorization. To do so, the FCA is looking for projects involved in the Project Innovate program. The FCA is evaluating more than 150 startups and 40 of them will be approved for further study.

item.title: How do I earn 1000 rupees daily with bitcoin trading?
item.description:
How do I earn 1000 rupees daily with bitcoin trading?

Answer (1 of 3): As you want to earn 1K on daily basis through Bitcoin Trading, you need give so much of time for it. Because of volatility issues related with Bitcoin, there is being high risk of loss and at same place high chance to gain.

item.title: A 'Brave' New Benchmark: Putting the Browser's Hype to the Test
item.description:
A 'Brave' New Benchmark: Putting the Browser's Hype to the Test

We previously tested a very early build of Brave to see what kind of performance the new browser was packing. The thing is, that build wasn't feature-complete or optimized for release.

item.title: CEX.IO Introduces New Fee Schedule to Improve Bitcoin Trading
item.description:
CEX.IO Introduces New Fee Schedule to Improve Bitcoin Trading

CEX.IO, the London-based cryptocurrency exchange, has introduced a new feature to its fee schedule, its most recent innovation to encourage higher market liquidity and improve bitcoin trading. The new Maker-Taker fee schedule sets the maker fee to 0%. The 0% maker fee is CEX.IO's latest incentive to make bitcoin trading and commerce easier.

item.title: Major Turkish Exchange Shuts Down Following Banking Suspension
item.description:
Major Turkish Exchange Shuts Down Following Banking Suspension

Bitcoin in Turkey has come under renewed pressure as longstanding Turkish exchange BTCTurk has its bank accounts shut down. Also read: Bitwala Steps Up to Replace PayPal with Bitcoin in Turkey BTCTurk, which started trading in 2013, said it was currently trying to refund customer balances in the face of the unexpected withdrawal of banking relations.

item.title: UK Blockchain Projects Near Regulatory Approval - CoinDesk
item.description:
UK Blockchain Projects Near Regulatory Approval - CoinDesk

UK regulators are reportedly moving forward with efforts that would find blockchain firms exiting a sandbox program aimed at encouraging innovation. According to a report by The Financial Times , the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is currently considering whether to approve several blockchain-based products for use by domestic consumers and businesses.

item.title: R3, HSBC Experts: Collaboration is Key for Blockchain Potential
item.description:
R3, HSBC Experts: Collaboration is Key for Blockchain Potential

HSBC and its partner, Bank of America's Merrill Lynch, recently published a proof of concept to demonstrate how Blockchain-powered contracts can be used to replace paper letters of credit which are commonly used in international trade.

item.title: BlockPay Pre-ICO Will Go Live Tomorrow
item.description:
BlockPay Pre-ICO Will Go Live Tomorrow

Disclaimer: The Merkle does not endorse the BlockPay team, their project, or any services coming forth from this concept. Always invest at your own risk. Not too long ago, we touched upon the BlockPay company, which wants to bring cryptocurrency to the commerce sector.

item.title: Japanese Banks Plan Blockchain Forex Services
item.description:
Japanese Banks Plan Blockchain Forex Services

A new consortium of Japanese banking and financial services giants will seek to use blockchain technology to provide domestic and foreig n exchange services. Japanese financial services giant SBI Holdings and its subsidiary SBI Ripple Asia, have collaborated to launch a consortium that will seek to use blockchain innovation - the technology underpinning bitcoin - in new payment and settlement services from October 2016.

item.title: Major Chinese Exchange CHBTC CEO: Chinese Government Giving Positive Signals with Digital Currencies
item.description:
Major Chinese Exchange CHBTC CEO: Chinese Government Giving Positive Signals with Digital Currencies

In an extended interview with CCN to be published soon, Dawei Lee, Chief Executive of CHBTC, China's biggest ETH and ETC trading exchange and fourth by volume for BTC, stated: Recently the government in China has been giving positive signals in regards to digital currency and blockchain technology.
